TEMPLE_RECRUIT1_DESCRIPTION: Confessors of %s await to teach you the ways of the church and how to become a devoted servant.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_RECRUIT2_DESCRIPTION: Mystic symbols and ritual objects are used to dedicate the lives of the faithful to %s.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_NAVE_DESCRIPTION: Beautiful light streams into this majestic hall.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_TITHE1_DESCRIPTION: The temple of %s is sustained by gifts from its patrons. To donate ten percent of your wealth, please step forward.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_TITHE2_DESCRIPTION: Murals line this room of all the good works done by the patrons of %s.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_PRESTIGE_DESCRIPTION: Mosaics and holy writing of %s cover the walls of this area of quiet reflection.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_MISSION_DESCRIPTION: A %s consults oracles of how the faithful may serve %s.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_HERMITAGE_DESCRIPTION: This is the simple dwelling of a lowly hermit.
HEAVILY_LOOTED_REMAINS_OF_RICH_DECORATIO: Heavily looted remains of rich decoration are all to show where the private mysteries of %s were observed.
TEMPLE_POOL_DESCRIPTION: A large baptismal font fills this room.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_HUITZILOPOCHTLI_DESCRIPTION: A large sacrifical platform is covered in food, treasure and shackles.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SKYFATHER_DESCRIPTION: Walls of unmelting ice rise up here and the ceiling is open to the sky.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_QUETZALCOATL_DESCRIPTION: Motifs of feathered serpents grace the bookshelves of the temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_LOFTY_AND_MAJESTIC_TEMPLE_OF_WHITE_: This lofty and majestic temple of white marble is holy to the god of the highest heavens.
THE_XXX_OF_THE_TEMPLE_ONCE_ATE_THEIR_MEA: The %s of the temple once ate their meals here.
TEMPLE_OF_ZORUK_DESCRIPTION: Motifs of tools, of all crafts and professions, adorn the walls of this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_ENKI_DESCRIPTION: Twin streams flow into a carp filled pool before this great ziggurat.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_WATERBEARER_DESCRIPTION: Aqua and teal tiles line fountains and watercourses powered and lit by magical energy.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SECHCHEST_DESCRIPTION: The temple of yellow rock is open to the sky. The sun beams down on the deep sand covered floor.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THE_SPECKLED_GRANITE_OF_THIS_TEMPLE_COOL: The speckled granite of this temple cools flocks of geese, holy to the goddess of marriage.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_OKNADETA_DESCRIPTION: Ceremonial wrestling pits dot this room and the long lingering scent of exertion.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_INFIRMARY_DESCRIPTION: Holy water founts and specialist clerics cure spiritual ailments in this room.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_LOVELY_TEMPLE_OF_ALABASTER_IS_DECKE: This lovely temple of alabaster is decked with many floral tributes to the goddess of love.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_MIXCOATL_DESCRIPTION: Shiny mica pics out the milky way across the dark ceiling of the temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_TEMPLE_IS_OF_FIRE_BRICK_AND_GREAT_F: This temple is of fire brick and great furnaces roar for the god of blacksmiths.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_HARPER_DESCRIPTION: Plesant music fills the room and performers and orators raise their praises.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TOMBS_LIE_CRACKED_OPEN_HERE_WHERE_GENERA: Tombs lie cracked open here, where generations of faithful were buried.
TEMPLE_OF_MOSENOA_DESCRIPTION: Revered here are the fruits of the forest and field provided by the goddess for the Elves.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_WOODEN_TEMPLE_HAS_PORTALS_OPEN_IN_A: This wooden temple has portals open in all four directions for the god of messengers.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_TEMPLE_IS_SOLIDLY_CONSTRUCTED_OF_GR: This temple is solidly constructed of great blocks of stones and is highly fortified for the god of War.
THIS_TEMPLE_IS_CIRCLE_OF_PILLARS_OPEN_TO: This temple is circle of pillars open to the sky, for the god of the sun.
TEMPLE_OF_HEARTHMOTHER_DESCRIPTION: A large fire burns in the center of the room, embers rising up through the smokehole in the roof.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_CORAL_TEMPLE_IS_CARVED_WITH_HORSES_: This coral temple is carved with horses and is holy to the god of the ocean.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_WAS_ONCE_A_PLESANT_WALKWAY_FOR_MEDI: This was once a plesant walkway for meditation.
TEMPLE_OF_SINANETA_DESCRIPTION: Graceful statues and paintings show all manner of Elven dance from sacred ritual to folk.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_DOM_DESCRIPTION: Instructional scenes from famous cave battles between the dwarves and underground advesaries cover the walls of this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_MARDUK_DESCRIPTION: Massive winged bulls flank a statue, it's arms raised in blessing.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_TEMPLE_IS_COVERED_IN_MANY_HANGING_B: This temple is covered in many hanging baskets growing herbs and produce for the goddess of crops.
THIS_LONG_PILLARED_ROOM_WAS_WHERE_THE_GR: This long, pillared room was where the great religious processions of %s would pass.
TEMPLE_OF_GRAVEKEEPER_DESCRIPTION: The smell of embalming fluid lingers here as the dead are prepared on raised stone slabs.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SHIMAK_DESCRIPTION: Forestry, agriculture, animal husbandry and child rearing are celebrated in statues and frescoes here.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THERE_IS_A_DESECRATED_SHRINE_TO_XXX_HERE: There is a desecrated shrine to %s here where small sacrifices are made.
TEMPLE_OF_LILAIVO_DESCRIPTION: Great charitable works of the Elven Goddess of Mercy and her followers are celebrated here.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_BARE_ROOM_WAS_WHERE_THE_CLERGY_ORGA: This bare room was where the clergy organized their daily activities.
THIS_OPEN_AREA_SEPARATED_THE_SACRED_AREA: This open area separated the sacred area from the profane.
TEMPLE_OF_ISHTAR_DESCRIPTION: A great gate of blue stones, flanked by lions, greets you at this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
BENEATH_A_ONCE_MAJESTIC_STATUE_OF_XXX_IS: Beneath a once majestic statue of %s is a large alter for public sacrifices.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_TEMPLE_IS_MADE_OF_LIVING_TREES_WITH: This temple is made of living trees, with many handmaidens devoted to the goddess of the hunt.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_MARTIUS_DESCRIPTION: Sharp steel weapons line this room and grey eyed warriors practice games of tactics..
TEMPLE_OF_KHIRZUD_DESCRIPTION: The rough hewn rock of this temple evokes a mine shaft, with veins of precious ore and gems as decorative points.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
BROKEN_PEWS_LINE_WHERE_CONGREGANTS_SAT_: Broken pews line where congregants sat.
ROTTEN_BUNKS_LIE_HERE_WHERE_THE_STAFF_OF: Rotten bunks lie here where the staff of the temple once slept.
TEMPLE_OF_ARAUR_DESCRIPTION: A great statue of the god stands here directing the affairs of the Elven pantheon as High King.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_TEZCATLIPOCA_DESCRIPTION: Obsidian inlay glints from from the dark stone of this stepped pyramid. A large jaguar lies here and observes you serenely.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
FILTH_AND_TRASH_DIRTY_THE_FLOOR_WHERE_TH: Filth and trash dirty the floor where the holy one of %s lived.
THIS_IS_WHERE_THE_XXX_USED_TO_CONDUCT_SE: This is where the %s used to conduct services.
THE_MURALS_AND_FRESCOES_ON_THE_WALLS_HER: The murals and frescoes on the walls here once welcomed worshipers of %s.
A_SHALLOW_POOL_REMAINS_HERE_THAT_WAS_USE: A shallow pool remains here that was used for annointing believers. It is now covered in green scum.
THESE_WERE_THE_PRIVATE_APARTMENTS_OF_THE: These were the private apartments of the %s of %s.
TEMPLE_OF_LACHKAKE_DESCRIPTION: Fountains play in warm pools and the air is full of the scent of fresh herbs and ungents.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THE_PRIOR_OF_THE_TEMPLE_ONCE_USED_THIS_A: The prior of the temple once used this as their office.
TEMPLE_OF_ASHUR_DESCRIPTION: A gilt covered and winged solar disk shines down over the steps of the ziggurat.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
EMPTY_NICHES_LINE_THIS_ROOM_WHERE_THE_HO: Empty niches line this room where the holy artifacts of %s were once housed.
TEMPLE_OF_ENLIL_DESCRIPTION: This high ziggurat reaches up to the very clouds.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_BENAD_DESCRIPTION: This heavily fortified temple is decorated with stout shields of metal and leather.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_WEAVER_DESCRIPTION: Elaborate tapestries hang on the walls depicting the goddess dispensing the gifts of weaving.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_NERCCANGA_DESCRIPTION: Trophies and skins adorn this room in tribe to the bounty provided by the great hunts{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}.
THIS_PILLARED_TEMPLE_HAS_A_GREAT_STATUE_: This pillared temple has a great statue of the goddess of Wisdom in its courtyard.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_YACUILA_DESCRIPTION: The god is depicted in sombre mosaics judging the souls of the Elven dead and directing their reincarnation.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_SOMBER_BASALT_TEMPLE_IS_DEDICATED_T: This somber basalt temple is dedicated to the god of the underworld.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SETA_DESCRIPTION: Generation after generation have engraved names in lineages on the hard granite of the temple's walls.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
THIS_IS_A_BRIEF_PASSAGE_LEADING_BETWEEN_: This is a brief passage leading between portions of the temple.
TEMPLE_OF_ORE_DESCRIPTION: The High Queen of the Elven gods is depicted here listening to her petitioners and giving counsel to the gods.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_NQANNATA_DESCRIPTION: Heavy inscence fills the air of this room giving worshipers access to the prophetic dreams of their god.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_TLALOC_DESCRIPTION: Rain is channeled from the roof of the temple through decorative falls and into large cisterns.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_TOMAUKO_DESCRIPTION: This temple is open to the sky with many images of the sun shining down on icons of the royal family.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_KAMATEKO_DESCRIPTION: Bronze mirrors and jade ornaments decorate this lovely temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SHINSHIMI_DESCRIPTION: Large, green skinned demons in leopard skins adorn the sacred windmills of this holy shrine.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_OMIRA_DESCRIPTION: Eight banners blazoned with crossed arrows fly from this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_ATUM_DESCRIPTION: A great red granite obelisk dominates this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SHU_DESCRIPTION: Peaceful cooling winds drift through the fat lotus columns of this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_TEFNUT_DESCRIPTION: Lotus blossoms float on pleasent pools in this cool temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_GEB_DESCRIPTION: Snakes sun themselves on the warm solid rocks of this temple, watching you as you pass.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_NUT_DESCRIPTION: The ceiling of the templed is painted as the dark night sky. But looking closer you can also see it is a woman.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_OSIRIS_DESCRIPTION: A great monument lies before you of a green skinned man holding royal symbols and wrapped as a mummy.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_ISIS_DESCRIPTION: A statue of a woman suckling her child hovers in midair lit by magical light.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_SETH_DESCRIPTION: Long lotus tipped columns line the wide avenues of this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_NEPHTHYS_DESCRIPTION: Great flagstaffs adorn a great trapezoidal tower that is the gateway to this temple.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_TILWARNA_DESCRIPTION: The great statue in this temple has four faces. One looking in each direction.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_JAMANO_DESCRIPTION: Intricate carvings line the walls here showing the god acting in many ways through the form of his avatars.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_BHIMA_DESCRIPTION: A great three eyed statue of the god looks down on you.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_DEVRAKOOT_DESCRIPTION: A beautiful marble statue of the goddess is here, seated on a lotus and playing a sitar.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_NINDARTHATA_DESCRIPTION: Lotus blossoms decorate this temple and the scent fills the air before the statue of this great, gold skinned woman.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
TEMPLE_OF_JARAMA_DESCRIPTION: Each hand of the multiarmed statue carries a weapon and the goddess strikes a fearsome pose to protect her own.{{room$SOUND_TEMPLE}}
